metadata.title: Use Healio SVG Logo Mark in Site UI Branding (Header/Footer/Dashboard)
metadata.prd_reference: Frontend polish and trust-oriented presentation for production-readiness

context.background: The favicon/tab icon now uses a Healio-branded SVG mark. This task reuses that logo mark within the visible site UI (marketing header/footer and/or dashboard branding) so the product has consistent branding instead of placeholder letter blocks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use the same SVG logo mark as the favicon (`/icon.svg`) or an equivalent shared logo component to ensure brand consistency.
Logo treatment must remain legible on light backgrounds and at small sizes in headers/navigation.
Preserve existing layout spacing and CTA hierarchy while replacing placeholder text blocks/letter badges with a proper logo treatment.
Changes should be production-facing only (no dev/instructional UI additions).

instruction.step: Create a reusable Healio logo UI component (or equivalent pattern) that renders the SVG logo mark plus optional wordmark text.
Replace placeholder branding in visible site UI areas (at minimum marketing landing header and footer) with the reusable logo.
If dashboard shell branding uses placeholder branding, update key dashboard branding surface(s) to use the same logo treatment without disrupting UX.
Run `npm run typecheck` after UI changes.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify desktop/mobile rendering, logo visibility, and no console errors on the homepage (and one dashboard page if updated there).

validation_checklist.check: The visible site includes a recognizable Healio logo mark (not only favicon/tab icon).
Landing page header/footer branding uses the SVG logo consistently.
Chrome DevTools MCP evidence includes desktop/mobile snapshots and console review.

artifacts.artifact: Reusable logo component and branded UI integration

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The site visibly uses the Healio logo mark in primary branding areas, not just the browser tab icon.
Branding is visually consistent across updated surfaces and remains legible on desktop/mobile.
Chrome DevTools MCP verification evidence is recorded before task completion.
Task XML is updated and renamed with `DONE_` prefix after completion.

output_spec.commit_message: feat(healio-branding): use svg logo in site branding surfaces

execution_tracking.verification_command: cd healio && npm run typecheck; Chrome DevTools MCP verify logo rendering on http://localhost:3002 (landing desktop/mobile) and http://localhost:3002/appointments (dashboard shell), including DOM checks for img[src*='icon.svg'] and console review.
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Added reusable HealioLogo component backed by /icon.svg and replaced placeholder branding blocks in marketing header/footer plus dashboard header/sidebar. MCP verified visible logo integration and no console warnings/errors.

evidence.item: Changed files: healio/components/shared/healio-logo.tsx; healio/components/marketing/landing-header.tsx; healio/components/marketing/marketing-footer.tsx; healio/components/layout/sidebar.tsx; healio/components/layout/header.tsx; healio/tsconfig.tsbuildinfo
Typecheck executed: cd healio && npm run typecheck
Chrome DevTools MCP landing page verification (desktop + mobile): header/footer logo placements render; mobile header retains menu + CTA layout with logo visible.
Chrome DevTools MCP DOM checks on landing page: header img[src*='icon.svg'] count=1, footer count=1, computed size 32x32.
Chrome DevTools MCP dashboard verification on /appointments: sidebar and dashboard header each include img[src*='icon.svg'] (count=1 each).
Chrome DevTools MCP console review on landing and /appointments: no warn/error messages.
Feature commit: 4abb627 (feat(healio-branding): use svg logo in site branding surfaces).
